subject: Gardening
title: The Colorado Potato Beetle Saga
description: A quick, practical guide to The Colorado Potato Beetle Saga.

hook.text: The Colorado potato beetle has evolved resistance to over 50 different pesticides. It's the world's most adaptable pest.

buildup.text: Originally feeding on buffalo bur in the Rockies, it switched to potatoes when settlers planted them across the West.

discovery.text: By 1874, the beetle had spread from Colorado to the Atlantic coastâ€”riding the wave of potato monoculture expansion.

twist.text: Every new insecticide works for a few years, then the beetle evolves resistance. It now resists nearly every class.

climax.text: The Colorado beetle proves that monoculture creates superpests. Diversity remains the only durable defense strategy.

punchline.text: Fifty pesticides later, the beetle is still winning.

quiz.question: What enabled the Colorado potato beetle to become a devastating pest?
options: Global warming expanded its habitat range northward
It switched from wild buffalo bur to potatoes as settlers expanded monocultures
It was accidentally introduced from Europe in contaminated grain shipments
